summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from July 2019 discussing the status of the Jeffrey Epstein investigation, focusing on evidence analysis (images, binders), potential charges (child pornography), coordination with SDNY, victim services, and planning for searches and interviews. It reveals ongoing efforts to assess seized materials and manage a large number of victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as JE, the central figure in the investigation. The email discusses evidence seized from his residence, including images and binders, and potential charges related to child pornography and his conduct with minors.

events.title: Internal FBI coordination calls
events.description: Calls held to coordinate the Epstein investigation efforts between FBI New York and SDNY, leading to the summarized email.

events.title: Request for evidence clarification
events.description: An FBI official requests specific answers regarding the scale of potential child pornography images (CP), the contents of seized binders with victim names, and the nature of the images.

events.title: Planning for search of Epstein's island
events.description: Discussions indicate the FBI is developing probable cause (PC) to execute a search warrant (SM) on Jeffrey Epstein's island in St. Thomas, based on victim statements, open-source reporting, and seized images.

keyFacts: Investigators seized 'dozens of images of young looking girls posing naked' from Epstein's NY residence, but could not confirm if they were minors except for one girl who was around 17.
Binders found in a closet contained names believed to be victims and the name of 'one of the co-conspirators,' but no confirmed victim identities.
One identified girl stated photos were taken at Epstein's island in St. Thomas.
The FBI was actively building a case for potential child pornography charges based on 'lascivious display of the genitals' in images and Epstein's alleged conduct with minors.
The victim count at the time was 59, and victim services were a stated high priority, with coordination for interviews in Florida.
